channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bins on pavement, 21st January
item.description:
These Ritson Road residents keep their bins on the pavement 24/7. Which makes it dangerous for wheelchair users and those with sight impairments. And difficult for parents/carers with pushchairs. Please can Hackney Council ask them to observe the rules?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ritson Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: I am the Chairman of Erith Playhouse DA8 1QY. We had blocked drains and have cleared them on our property but the issue seems to be on the highway land outside. This is obviously causing us health & safety issues with having toilets out if action during shows. Can you please advise of the next steps. Please note following a full laryngectomy I am currently unable to speak but could someone else to do this if required. Thank you, 21st January
item.description:
See above

item.title: White line needs repainting, 21st January
item.description:
Several years ago I received agreement for a white line across these two garages. Bromley came out and visited and it was approved and painted. The white line is now faded and needs repainting. As it isn’t visible are repeatedly getting cars parked and blocking the garages. Please can this be restored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmcroft Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road damage and water ponding over CP Subway (North side of road), 21st January
item.description:
There is road damage and water ponding over Crystal Palace Subway (North side of road), causing sustained water egress into the ground. Progressive road work repairs has re-profiled road surface, and means surface water now ponds directly over Grade II Subway, and does not drain away. This ponding slowly soaks into the ground above the Subway adding containments and adding issues when the ground is saturated. Additionally, the heavily cracked road surface adds to surface water and contaminants soaking into the ground above the Subway. The ponding water and road surface damage above the CP Subway could be impacting how to prove a mains water leak into the CP Subway under, and contributing to the ongoing leak seen inside the Grade II* CP Subway. The road surface needs to relayed, and reprofiled near the kerb on the North side, to stop ponding of water on top of the Subway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at the back of 52 park view road, 21st January
item.description:
There is a resident that is using the car parking space at the back of 52 park view road to store a skip and leave a load of fly tipping. This has been going on for months and the residents are struggling to park and the rubbish is a mess. They are concerned that this may attached rodents
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park View Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
